Author: Mark_l
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: Do you have anything concrete to back that statement up? Of course you are entitled to you opinion, everyone is entitled to think what they want.. but if there's some solid info behind that comment I'd love to hear it? Please don't take this as someone trying to call you out in the way you'd normally expect on an internet forum, I don't mean it in a 'put up or shut up' kind of way.  I would geuninely love to know if you know something I don't? Or maybe we just see things differently..?  When I look at this I see a small team working away releasing new functionality every month or so. That same team have been very responsive when I have contacted them to report bugs and sugest things.  There's a blockchain explorer and test transactions that work as they should. Mining rewards are also working well.  When I pulled apart the node client just after the launch of the public Beta and WireSharked the traffic everything looked legit.  From where I sit it still looks like an OK project, albeit one that has been delayed. It certainly doesn't feel like a scam, but maybe that just because of the interactions I've had?  Now don't get me wrong I'm not saying that it IS an ok project, and I'm not advising anyone to invest any money, it's just that from where I sit doesn't look anything like a scam and if I'm wrong I'd love to know.

Author: Mark_l
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App

Author: Mark_l
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: Define 'invest'?  I decided that instead of just handing over money, I'd make use of my technical knowledge and I purchased quite a bit of equipment to mine with. Not only does that cost money, up front, but it's depreciating every month, and I'm also paying an electricity bill each month in one of the most expensive countries on earth.  Then add in the several hundred hours I've spent, getting/keeping everything running, helping people, tracking down bugs, etc.  I suspect I have much more 'invested' in this than you, and that should tell you something.  Why would I bother if I didn't think it was worth it? I could have chosen any other coin, but there's something different about Avesta.  If, and I repeat 'if', they do manage to do what they say they will try to do then it should be very sucessfull.  I suspect we see things differently not because we have 'invested' different ammounts, but because we went into this with different expectations. I'm not in any hurry to see them dump on an exchange. I'd rather they kept doing what they have been doing, and when the time is right, be it 2018, 2019, or whatever, then they list on an exchange once all the functionality is there.  I'm also ready to lose everything I have put into this, knowing from the start that this was like buying a lottery ticket. There is a really good chance you'll get nothing back from ICO's in general, but if your careful and through a combination of luck and judgement pick the right coin.. it's happy days.  I honestly wish you all the best, and please, don't be in such a hurry.

Author: Mark_l
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: It's still in beta form. The propper platform hasn't even been launched yet, of course there's no one using it.  They also aren't planning to try and get users in the 'normal' way for a crypto currency (driven by exchange listings and speculative trading). They are building a complete crypto payment solution that is aimed at businesses, thier customers, people that don't have bank accounts, etc. They probably haven't even got to the point of trying to on board anyone yet. That's what atracted me to the coin, it's a different approach.  Also, please consider this... if you honestly believe you have lost your money then PM me with your Avesta balance and we'll have a chat about me buying it from you. It'll be at about 0.001 euro per AVE, but if you HONESTLY believe you've lost your money you'll rip my arm off, at least you'll get something back.  If your not willing to do that then you must still have some hope that Avesta will work out (as I do, and for the good reasons I have outlined).  In that case, is trying to tear the house down while your still standing in it such a good idea?  Seriously, my advice to you is to please take a breath, calm down, and be patient.

Author: Mark_l
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: Your very welcome, glad I could help   I normally pop by every couple of days to see if I can help out with anything. From what I gather the devs are really busy and it's a small team so the boards get little attention at the moment.  You probably already know, but the underlying algo is based on cryptonight, so when you configure the number of threads you'll want to do Level 3 cache in MB / 2MB = threads to configure the miner to use, or number of cores = threadcount. Use which ever is the smaller number.  Happy mining!

Author: Mark_l
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: I'm going to chip in my 2 cents worth here...  Last year I went through 100's of ICO's assessing them for viability. There were lots of fun and quirky offerings that were trying to launch based on some novel idea like replacing securities exchanges, simplifying supply lines and similar.  They were all well and good, but I was looking for a coin that had the best chance of replacing cash\card payments.  From a technical perspective (asuming everything gets delivered), Avesta should be miles ahead of everything else in this regard.  - Exchange listing by the end of the year. - Debit card by the end of the year. - 10s block time - Extremely low transaction fees - A bunch of other stuff like smart contracts, multi currency walet, invoicing, accounting, etc.  Asuming it all gets delivered (the dev team are doing a cracking job so far!) that's a great combination.  No one knows whats going to happen in the future, based based on what we have seen so far this project looks like a good bet.  If you haven't started mining yet it's not to late to come and join us and get on board, just don't leave it much longer.

Author: AvestaOfficialAccount
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: Happy Friday everyone!   I hope you are all having a great day today! I have good news! Mining is back online for all nodes.  There was a bug and it caused the incorrect output of hashrate and difficulty.  The Team has been working very hard to solve this problem and believe that it should be fixed.  Please do report any errors that are still happening, as your feedback is essential in confirming that services are fully operational.   The web wallet should come back online soon and fix the 0 balance display. If any of you have synced a wallet from 0, you know how long this can take with a larger blockchain.  Please be aware that it can take 24 hours or longer.  The Transaction History should now show up after wallet re-sync.  E-Payments and business modules are getting the finishing touches and should be fully operational.  What more can I say other than we have a fantastic team of developers that are fixing errors and optimizing everything to make your experience a pleasurable one.  Thank you all for your continued support! And, As Always, Happy Mining!

Author: Mark_l
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: Thank you for the info   I must say that apart from that hickup things have been a lot more stable lately, and it's been great seeing the platform functionality taking shape over the last few months.  Mining has also improved massively!  For anyone that's missed it... if you are mining your command line to start the miner should look something like this (I'm running Linux on my miners, if your using Windows it'll be a little different but basically th same):  Path to miner.exe --account *10 digit acount number* --name *worker name* --threads *number of cores or lvl3 cache size in MB / 2, whichever is less* --daemon-address *Mining node* --scan-time 1  Mining Nodes:  eu.avesta.network:2282 = Europe us.avesta.network:2282 = US as.avesta.network:2282 = Asia

Author: Mark_l
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: The site and chain is constantly being worked on and whenever they make a change everything desync's. All the wallets go back to 0 (edit - untill they resync and the correct balance is shown).  I've also figured out how to get round the rejected blocks  issue. Blocks get rejected because someone else beat you to the punch.  Ignore the below, just add --scan-time 1 to your command line when you launch the miner, it has a similar effect and works better.  Normally the mining servers would notify all connected clients that a block had been found and it would distribute the new target at the same time, but this isn't happening.  The client just mines untill either 30 seconds is up, or it finds a block, whichever comes first.  But... if you restart your miner every 5->10 seconds it'll have far more up to date information and your success rate will go WAY up.  Now I'm doing this 9 out of 10 blocks get submitted ok, before it was 1 in 30.  But here's the problem..... if we all do this will we overload the servers with connection attempts?  Also, you have to balance out the down time of restarting the miner against the time spent mining. It takes about .3 of a second to kill and restart the miner so it's mining again on my system/internet connection. If I restart every second I'll lose aalmost a third of my hash rate.  I've found that somewhere between 5 and 10 seconds is the sweet spot, but your mileage may vary.

Author: AvestaOfficialAccount
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: Hey guys, I've recently spoken with some team members and they have assured me things are on the up and up...  Mostly when you hear silence from the team of any project, they are working so hard...  I mean, how would you feel if you were trying to work on something and someone keeps distracting you with other tasks or questions, yep you'd be like don't talk to me right now I'm trying to concentrate and get things done...  So let's give the entire team a big thanks for working on the Avesta project so hard.  Remember guys, this hasn't been upgraded from beta version yet. Look at the post from January of this year when they launched the mainnet.  https://avesta.io/en/avesta-launch-platform-wallet-and-mining/  It is plain black and white BETA.  So YES there will be bugs.  YES there will be bumps.  If you don't report your bugs, then the developers won't know what's going on from your point of view. If you have never done this before, or did not know about it. You can do a bug report here.  https://app.smartsheet.com/b/form/5d50731a5d5b4b13886bb3810a0bc2c1  That link will allow you to report your bugs straight to the team! You will be helping Avesta to grow.  And just like Mark has said above if your wallet ever shows incorrect or 0, it means that the team has been working on the wallet and the back end was updated. (Remember, all the changes being done are for preparation of the Point of Sale and Exchange integrations.) The wallet then has to re-sync to the block-chain just like any other wallet. So give it some time and check back. Your coins are always safe on the chain!  Let's work together and bring Avesta to the moon where it belongs!  Thank you all for your continued support!  And, As Always, Happy Mining!

Author: AvestaOfficialAccount
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: Wow I'm sorry to hear that you are getting that kind of rate of rejected blocks.  Can I ask what is your ping to the different nodes and your geographical location?  We do have plans to open up a Europe node to accommodate miners in the general area of the UK hoping to help with latency.  Things are very very busy at the moment as we are working on migrating the wallet among other things that are also happening at the same time.  The blockchain is being worked on as we speak to fix this annoying reject rate.  Also, be aware that your AVE will have some worth, coming very soon!  Thank you for your continued support! And, as always, Happy Mining!

Author: AvestaOfficialAccount
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: Glad to hear that everything is A-ok on your wallet displaying correctly.  Yes, I understand what you mean about traditional web wallets and the security of such things. Our wallet is unlike any traditional crypto currency wallet, as your account number is your wallet address with Avesta. We believe that you should be able to memorize your wallet address just like with any other account number or phone number. Not with a complicated hexadecimal address.  Our development team has been working on the e-payment module and getting everything set-up so that retailers will be able to accept our Avesta using the pos system built into our app!  It's very exciting to see all these things being developed to change how we use our currencies!  Thank you for your continued support! And, as always, Happy Mining!

Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: Ok guys, what's going on? Are you having that much of a hard time of mining? The network hashrate is very low right now.   We have users on our Facebook group AvestaMining reporting that they're submitting more blocks than rejects now. If you haven't joined please do so. There's many many resources available within our Facebook mining community.  One good thing that I can suggest if you haven't done so already and maybe try it out anyways...  Re-Download the mining software from our mining page and setup your miner from scratch again. It might just help with some of your errors. Please report back to us your errors.  Thank you all for your continued support! And, as always, Happy Mining!

Author: jackbox
Title: [ANN][AVE][ICO] Avesta PoW 10s blocktime+accountnumbers+Inheritance+Private+App
Body: Yes, in fact mining has been very difficult. The daemon servers often return bad data or do not respond. Also the miner program provided crashes often. And you get 4 to 5X rejected blocks for accepted blocks when everything works. You need to get your backend more robust. When I have a lot of issues I simply stop mining for a day or two before checking again if it is working again.
